sense.name: a general orientation or positioning of something
sense.examples: The scout climbed to the top of the hill to get a better lay of the surrounding countryside. Roll the carpet against the lay of the nap. The new employees will need a little time to learn the lay of the landscape around here. (metaphoric extension)

sense.name: vulgar term for sexual intercourse
sense.examples: The sailors had been at sea for three months without a lay. The price of a lay in the red light district was more than he had imagined.

sense.name: vulgar term for a sexual partner
sense.examples: He wondered whether she would be a good lay. Mary told her friends that John was a lousy lay.

sense.name: the act of laying an egg
sense.examples: The woman went to the henhouse to collect the eggs from the most recent lay. The older chickens had less prodigious lays than the younger ones.

sense.name: a short lyric or poem intended to be sung
sense.examples: It was a catchy little lay that everyone at work seemed to know. He sang a merry lay as he walked along the country road.
